intro: Hieracium prenanthopsis, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grassy areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium prenanthopsis is often found in open habitats and can sometimes be invasive in certain regions.
